entry.title: Revert "[BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e680c77a639d1ff4b29e033be0cc47e5194acf6c.



Reason for revert: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/fuchsia-arm64-rel/7878/overview ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestBrowserTest.Subresource_FetchHandler_Wins_Redirect failing





Original change's description:

> [BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility

>

> This is a follow-up of crrev.com/c/4668647

>

> This CL makes BestEffortServiceWorker redirect handling consistent with

> the current default behavior by not handling redirect responses.

>

> When redirects happen, currently RaceNetworkRequest handles them by

> itself, for the main and subresources respectively. For main resources,

> the loader marks the state as completed and defer the second request to

> its owner, which is NavigationURLLoaderImpl. For subresources, the

> loader follows redirects and dispatch a second request, then handle it.

>

> The current behavior is problematic because as a default, ServiceWorker

> handles redirections "inside" its fetch event, which can involve opaque

> responses or opaque redirect responses, and returns them to the

> browser/renderer process. But if BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled,

> redirections are handled in RaceNetworkRequest, and responses are not

> forwarded to the SW fetch handler, that could be a compatibility issue

> especially for the Cache storage consistency.

>

> This CL fixes this problem by not handling the redirect response in the

> RaceNetworkRequest. More correctly, RaceNetworkRequest as a

> URLLoaderClient receives a redirect signal, then immediately forward it

> to the other URLLoaderClient, which is fused to the endpoint in blink

> side in order for the dedupe. And RaceNetworkRequest starts waiting from

> the second response and doesn't do a race anymore.

>

> URLLoader endpoints are well distributed and fused for the dedupe

> between RaceNetworkRequest and the fetch request in SW, here is a rough

> diagram of URLLoader relations.

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eotFetBW9RUE2sYjCnVl7P8rbvIsWBJcy3NOswC5kek/edit#bookmark=id.sx0vwv3n7gut

>

> This CL also removes the code canceling in-flight RaceNetworkRequests in

> the main and subresource loader classes. It used to be a reasonable

> approach, but after we introduced a dedupe mechanism, it increased test

> flakiness because sometimes data transport is not completed yet at the

> time when the loader received a response from fetch handler. Even if the

> ServiceWorker respond, the data pipe may be still active due to the

> redirect, StaleWhileRevalidate etc.

>

> Change-Id: Ifd72daec858c0e770e8938705dcbe01d17bfa0b1

> Bug: 1420517

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4668283

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169715}



Bug: 1420517

entry.title: shimless_rma: IWA for chromeos system extension
entry.content:
Refactor the system extension info:

* Add iwa id field for up coming iwa support for shimless rma.

* Use fixed_flat_map instead of std::map.

* Remove the unit test to check the size of the allowlist because now

the size is static by using fixed_flat_map.

* Rename GetChromeOSExtensionInfoForId to GetChromeOSExtensionInfoById.

* Construct the test overrides only once so we don't need to check them

every time.

* GetChromeOSExtensionInfoById return const reference instead of a copy.

entry.title: App Service: Remove obsolete AddPreferredApp method
entry.content:
The AddPreferredApp method has been fully replaced by

SetSupportedLinksPreference. The only additional functionality that

AddPreferredApp provides is support for setting the "stay in browser"

preference, but this is no longer possible in the UI.



This migrates the last caller of AddPreferredApp over to

SetSupportedLinksPreference, and removes AddPreferredApp entirely.

entry.title: Revert "Reland [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view..."
entry.content:
This reverts commit b4914c745b02fb787d11275845b70c0571f84a75.



Reason for revert: Breaking https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(Wayland)/39912/overview MenuItemViewTestInsert02.InsertItem02



Original change's description:

> Reland [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view...

>

> This CL does 3 things: expands lifetime, holds open for devtools, and

> significantly upgrades testability of the webui omnibox popup view.

>

> First, it expands the lifetime of OmniboxPopupPresenter to that of the

> owning OmniboxPopupViewWebUI instead of instantiating on demand during

> updates. This fixes an issue where initial input and suggestions were

> not shown by the popup.

>

> Additionally, this CL considers the devtools status before closing the

> popup so the native view can be inspected. See for more context:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4643132/comments/ac88c013_90e2aa58

>

> Finally, this CL makes it possible to cleanly test the webui omnibox

> popup view by first waiting for the webui handler to become available

> and bound by the remote. Before this blocking mechanism was

> implemented, there were various failure modes relating to the webui

> handler, particularly absence before navigation, and then even when

> it was present, calls could be made before the remote was bound, which

> would also cause crashes. Now it reliably navigates, binds, and works!

>

> Bug: 1458266, 1396174

> Change-Id: I96ad9213aaee6b4c598204f40dd8c697ec5da4d1

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4681919

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Reviewed-by: Moe Ahmadi

> Commit-Queue: Orin Jaworski

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169488}

entry.title: Vulkan/DRI: Only set YCbCr info for actual YCbCr multiplane formats
entry.content:
Intel GPU's CCS compression formats have two planes which confuses

Chromium, causing it to treat is as an YCbCr format when such a GBM

buffer is imported or created. Fix this by checking the VkFormat

directly instead of the buffer's plane count.

entry.title: [Policy] Status Box enhancements
entry.content:
The Status Box is created using fieldset, this CL transitions them to use Div instead.

Fieldsets are rarely used and don't look good.

They provide very few customisations and were primarily made to group form fields.



The CL also beautifies them by adding background colour (same as search), rounded corners, consistent sizing, responsiveness and better - margins, padding, and font.



Screenshots: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yEfBn3Czb1CRAW_TPJz2_IptDEi-73iQ/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: Mitigation for crash issue on MacOS due to thumbnail capture
entry.content:
We see increased crashes on MacOS when we added settings for hovercard.

The issue was seen for users even without the feature enabled. After

investigation we tracked it down to change when we introduced prefs for

hovercards we had to unconditionally enable the thumbnail helper. This

resulted in thumbnail capture to happen whenever the tabs were put into

the background irrespective of the pref state. As an initial mitigation

creating the tab helper only when the new settings flag is enabled. This

change is to unblock Canary and Dev channels. Subsequently we either

need to do further investigation on the crash issue which based on

previous investigation likely is due to graphic drivers or make this

capture conditional (though currently thumbnail logic is agnostic of

this).



Bug: 1374153

Change-Id: I09a820a3b3f5ab2c6b0195d0346ba287a21b4631

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4682617

Reviewed-by: Dana Fried

entry.title: [IP Protection] Initialize bsa_ in non-test code
entry.content:
Passes a per-profile SharedURLLoaderFactory to

IpProtectionAuthTokenGetter so that we can construct the BlindSignAuth

object as part of the non-test object creation flow.



Also, I wrote a browser test that attempts to use the created BSA object,

and this CL fixes some issues encountered from using that thus far.

Specifically:



- When building the URL that BSA should reach out to, we now add the

server host name



- kIpProtectionRequestMaxBodySize needed to be larger (set to 256 KB

which should avoid any issues with this in the future)



The browser test needs modifications to BSA to work correctly, so I'll

put it in a dependent CL and maybe land it at some point (I think we'd

need new testing methods in BSA to support this type of test).



Finally, this CL has some minor cleanup.



Bug: 1444621

Change-Id: I04c5f8f05a4e3345b45151b2321e772dbe841fea

Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable due to use of the BSA library

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility
entry.content:
This is a follow-up of crrev.com/c/4668647



This CL makes BestEffortServiceWorker redirect handling consistent with

the current default behavior by not handling redirect responses.



When redirects happen, currently RaceNetworkRequest handles them by

itself, for the main and subresources respectively. For main resources,

the loader marks the state as completed and defer the second request to

its owner, which is NavigationURLLoaderImpl. For subresources, the

loader follows redirects and dispatch a second request, then handle it.



The current behavior is problematic because as a default, ServiceWorker

handles redirections "inside" its fetch event, which can involve opaque

responses or opaque redirect responses, and returns them to the

browser/renderer process. But if BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled,

redirections are handled in RaceNetworkRequest, and responses are not

forwarded to the SW fetch handler, that could be a compatibility issue

especially for the Cache storage consistency.



This CL fixes this problem by not handling the redirect response in the

RaceNetworkRequest. More correctly, RaceNetworkRequest as a

URLLoaderClient receives a redirect signal, then immediately forward it

to the other URLLoaderClient, which is fused to the endpoint in blink

side in order for the dedupe. And RaceNetworkRequest starts waiting from

the second response and doesn't do a race anymore.



URLLoader endpoints are well distributed and fused for the dedupe

between RaceNetworkRequest and the fetch request in SW, here is a rough

diagram of URLLoader relations.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eotFetBW9RUE2sYjCnVl7P8rbvIsWBJcy3NOswC5kek/edit#bookmark=id.sx0vwv3n7gut



This CL also removes the code canceling in-flight RaceNetworkRequests in

the main and subresource loader classes. It used to be a reasonable

approach, but after we introduced a dedupe mechanism, it increased test

flakiness because sometimes data transport is not completed yet at the

time when the loader received a response from fetch handler. Even if the

ServiceWorker respond, the data pipe may be still active due to the

redirect, StaleWhileRevalidate etc.



Change-Id: Ifd72daec858c0e770e8938705dcbe01d17bfa0b1

entry.title: Shared Storage: Reduce number of chrome/ browser test params
entry.content:
Due to the hardware limitations on Android in particular that

constrain the total number of tests that can be run, and because the

`resolveToConfig` parameter is more fully tested already at the

content/ layer, as well as the need to add further tests for

additional Shared Storage features such as writing from response

headers

(e.g. https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4567296),

we further reduce the number of parameters used on

Android and also reduce the number on desktop.

entry.title: [zlib_bench] Allow user to print results in CSV format
entry.content:
This adds a new option (i.e. --cvs) that will print the results

of a benchmark in a tab separated format.



Usage: ./zlib_bench gzip --cvs ~/corpus/* > zlib_perf.csv



Makes it easier to import the results of a bench run into Google

Sheets (no more typing).

entry.title: SuperSize: Match up named string literals of differing paths
entry.content:
The previous logic was to never match up string literals when their

paths have changed. This makes sense when all string literal names are

"string literal", but it should be safe to match them up when their

names are "\"string prefix...\"", and their size has not changed.



Also fixes a bug where caspian was using PSS rather than size when

matching up symbols.



Motivated by supersize diff:

https://chrome-supersize.firebaseapp.com/viewer.html?load_url=https%3A%2F%2Fstorage.googleapis.com%2Fchromium-binary-size-trybot-results%2Fandroid-binary-size%2F2023%2F07%2F07%2F1543812%2Fsupersize_diff.sizediff&include=Failed+to+build#focus=16



Bug: 939221

Change-Id: Iffc40e33164dd17a9084963dd213d5a44d63b2d9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680272

Reviewed-by: Samuel Huang

Commit-Queue: Andrew Grieve

entry.title: WebUI: Migrate CustomizeChrome side panel tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest.
entry.content:
WebUIMochaBrowserTest is the new way of running WebUI tests without any

dependency to the obsolete js2gtest and test_api.js mechanism.



Also doing minor renaming of tests, now that previous js2gtest

constraint of having a dedicated C++ class for each test case does not

exist and and removing the somewhat meaningless '*.All' naming pattern.

Example renames:

- SidePanelCustomizeChromeButtonLabelTest.All ->

SidePanelCustomizeChromeTest.ButtonLabel

- SidePanelCustomizeChromeCardsTest.All ->

SidePanelCustomizeChromeTest.ChromeCards



which also makes running such tests much easier by specifying

--gtest_filter=SidePanelCustomizeChromeTest.* instead of

--gtest_filter=SidePanelCustomizeChrome*Test.All



Bug: 1457360

Change-Id: Ie621175a346c888a2356eab5ea98cba0fa8fcb8f

entry.title: Fix WPT custom-elements/reactions/Animation.html failure
entry.content:
We are currently failing the test for multiple reasons:



1. Missing `CEReactions` IDL attribute on `Animation.commitStyles()`,

so the `attributeChangedCallback` isn't fired synchronously even

though they are already enqueued. This patch adds it back to

match the spec [1].



2. When `commitStyles()` modifies more than one properties, we

enqueue one callback for each modified property. So this patch

enclose all the mutations in a `StyleAttributeMutationScope` to

make sure only one callback is enqueued.



3. `StyleAttributeMutationScope` currently doesn't enqueue the callback

if the style value doesn't change, but the spec requires the callback

to be always enqueued regardless of old and new values [2]. So this

patch changes `StyleAttributeMutationScope` to always enqueue the

callback.



[1] https://www.w3.org/TR/web-animations-1/#ref-for-dom-animation-commitstyles

[2] https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#handle-attribute-changes



Fixed: 1420808

Change-Id: I07524291029c583e252c75c0720cd954611831ff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4679919

Reviewed-by: Mason Freed

entry.title: sync: allow phone-as-a-security-key fields to be unset.
entry.content:
Since the PaaSK fields can take a little while to calculate, the values

from the stored DeviceInfo are used as a placeholder. However, it wasn't

possible for the calculated values to remove the PaaSK fields once they

were stored because a `nullopt` was taken as "not ready".



We want to remove PaaSK fields from Chrome instances installed in work

profiles so this change makes GetPhoneAsASecurityKeyInfo return an

`absl::variant` so that both "not ready" and "no fields" can be

expressed.



Change-Id: If606ea443f41355b2494b11abd05ca649680aa2f

entry.title: Log when getting system print settings
entry.content:
Getting of settings is already logged for printing with Print Preview.

Log similarly for case of system print, including detail to show if

the settings are acquired with calls made from in the browser process

or via the Print Backend service.



Some platforms are not able to get system print settings from a service,

even if all other printing calls can be made OOP. This provides extra

clarity during debugging and triage for issues around system print.

entry.title: [dPWA] Fix Segmentation crash in sites without manifest
entry.content:
If Segmentation triggers a dialog via ML classification result on a

site without a manifest, then AppBannerManager crashes in a couple

of places. During the investigation, it was noticed that ShowBannerUi

is only implemented IF the install checks pass, as a result of which

dismissing the app banner in the middle of ShowBannerUi leads to more

crashes.



This CL works as a fix in the meantime where the Installation flow no

longer relies on the AppBannerManager pipeline or its state, apart

from measuring a histogram that is independent of the pipeline data.



Bug: 1464349, b/290812152

entry.title: Add DnsConfigAndroidInProcessBrowserTest
entry.content:
This is for Android DNS config listener brokering

(design doc: https://bit.ly/3RhXbrJ)



DnsConfigAndroidInProcessBrowserTest confirms the current

behavior that DNS config change from SystemDnsConfigChangeNotifier in

the browser UI thread is received by

net::SystemDnsConfigChangeNotifier::Observer in the network service.



That is trivial so far because they are all on the browser process but

this test code will be reused to confirm the behavior with the brokering implementation on the sandboxed and out-of-process

network service environment.



Currently system_dns_config_observer.mojom is used only for testing to

get the received config result from the network service to the

content browser test thread.

However this mojo will be reused for Android DNS config listener

brokering implementation by exporting the DNS config change in the

browser UI thread to the network service.



Bug: 1320187

intended to be run when passed in through command line args or

name variant alone.

entry.title: [wptrunner] Add option to apply additional environment variable
entry.content:
run_wpt_tests.py already allows no-effect argument for additional_env_var.



Eg.

```

./third_party/blink/tools/run_wpt_tests.py --help

...

--additional-env-var ADDITIONAL_ENV_VAR

Passes that environment variable to the tests

(--additional-env-var=NAME=VALUE)

```

run_web_tests.py takes the argument and add them to the environment variable of test runner

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/web_tests/port/base.py;l=1700

This change allows run_wpt_tests.py to also pass environment variable to test runner by setting the env_var in main process which is then copied to test runner subprocesses.



Change-Id: I003870fdc090d5ef7358ef5c4a18e5d56de3433e

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Add presubmit check for redundant affected baselines
entry.content:
This change issues a warning to discourage CLs from landing redundant

baselines. This is done by calling `optimize-baselines --check` on the

tests corresponding to affected baselines.



To keep uploads/cycle times reasonably fast, this check is not enabled

for CI (`git cl presubmit --all`) or exceptionally large CLs.



Also, include the results of `optimize-baselines --all` so the presubmit

starts green.



Fixed: 1421188

This code was used in 2 different locations (in ValidateDidCommitParams

and in UpdateState), which makes it harder to tell which one is being

encountered in the wild. (This is especially true because some of the

stack frames are elided in the crash reports.)

where any remaining bugs are.

entry.title: Remove unused parameter from ExtensionsGuestViewManagerDelegate ctor
entry.content:
A recent CL removed the usage of a BrowserContext parameter from

ExtensionsGuestViewManagerDelegate. We now remove the parameter and

update the call sites.



While we're here, we refactor TestGuestViewManagerFactory so that we can

get rid of a bunch of code duplication across various test fixtures

which use TestGuestViewManager. Specifically, we have the factory

register itself when constructed instead of the fixture having to do it

separately and we introduce a common method to create the manager.

entry.title: Mac: ensure web content isn't obscured when find bar is active in immersive fullscreen
entry.content:
In immersive fullscreen, web contents are laid out from the top of

the window whether or not topchrome is showing. This means that when

the find bar is active and there are find results at the very top of the

page they may be obscured by the topchrome.



This change adjusts the web content offset to sit below the topchrome when the

find bar is active, and restores it when the find bar is hidden.

entry.title: Emit networkIdle following aborted client-side navigation
entry.content:
Currently, IdlenessDetector is kicked off at the time

DOMContentLoaded is dispatched. If the document parser

is aborted by client-side navigation, DOMContentLoaded

is never dispatched and hence IdlenessDetector is not

functional either. In case of a successful client-side

navigation, this may be the desired behavior, as all

events would then be dispatched by the succeeding page.

However, if the navigation is aborted, we're left in a

state where a CDP client that may rely on networkIdle

events is left in a suspended state. Since, technically,

an aborted navigation leads to networkIdle condition,

I think we should properly handle this case on the

idleness detector side.



Bug: 1462258

entry.title: Precisely set a webview's owner RenderFrameHost at creation
entry.content:
The previous logic for choosing the owner at guest creation time

only considered the main frame of the frame that made the extension

API call, which can be inaccurate when an extension has multiple frames

it can script. We now have the renderer inform the browser of the

RenderFrame associated with the document which owns the guest view

element.



We also add a number of test cases where a webview element is

created and/or attached by different documents.



Note that the previous logic before this CL was getting the initial

owner WebContents wrong in some cross app window cases (e.g. the

newly added testInsertIntoOtherWindow). This would needlessly trigger

the WebViewGuest::MaybeRecreateGuestContents code path. The new logic

selects the correct owner for these cases. This shouldn't be a

behaviour change since there would be no window references that would

be invalidated by the old behaviour.



Note that we don't need to handle the possibility of `owner_rfh()`

becoming null even when we start using subframes as owners. In the

attached case, the guest couldn't outlive it. In the unattached case,

if the iframe that created the guest element is detached, the element

becomes unusable (including by other documents that can script it),

due to the extension script context going away, so it can't go on to create a guest view. If a guest view already exists due to newwindow

usage, the newwindow attach method becomes similarly unusable. The

destruction of the guest that fired the newwindow event would also

trigger the destruction of the unattached guest due to its opener

relationship.



So while this shouldn't be a behaviour change, I've included a kill

switch to restore the assumed owner logic.



Bug: 769461

Change-Id: Ia44469b02a33c4bbe05bdcb00f24b9eca4a4178f

entry.title: webauthn: move PRF hashing into the browser.
entry.content:
WebAuthn says that PRF inputs are hashed with a prefix prior to being

used (for domain separation). Previously this was done in the renderer.

But to send PRF values to Android CredMan, which uses JSON, we'll need

to have them unhashed in the browser because the JSON is a

representation of the WebAuthn request.



However, when being a hybrid authenticator on Android, we receive hashed

inputs because they're always hashed before being sent over CTAP. Thus

on Android we have to deal with both hashed and unhashed values. Hashed

values can't be sent over CredMan so, in that situation, we have to

route the request directly to Play Services, which can accept such

values.



Now that unhashed values are passing over the Mojo pipe, this change

also adds a sanity check on their length. (Which should probably always

have been there.) Any values that are longer than 32 bytes have

misunderstood how PRF works, but the limit is set to 256 bytes out of

caution.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Fido2Api.java is the final interface to Play Services.

entry.title: Update notification state when blocker is added
entry.content:
Treat the addition of a new `NotificationBlocker` as a state-change

event, as if `NotificationBlocker::Observer::OnBlockingStateChanged()`

were called. Create a new `NotificationBlocker::Init()` method that must

be called after a `NotificationBlocker`'s ctor to avoid calling a

virtual function during construction. Update existing usages to the new

initialization pattern.

entry.title: Add support for ChildNodePart.clone()
entry.content:
This adds support for cloning a ChildNodePart directly.



In the process, a few small cleanups/refactors were made:

- Change NodeCloningData from a struct to a class.

- Rename Part::Clone() to Part::ClonePart(), to avoid confusion with

Part::clone().

- Remove CHECKs that ClonePart always finds its `root()`. With the

addition of ChildNodePart cloning, it is possible to find a Part

that has a `root()` outside the tree being cloned.

- Return the cloned Part from ClonePart() as a convenience, even

though it isn't used anywhere (yet).

entry.title: WebUI: Simplify the names and classes of c/b/r/history tests.
entry.content:
Now that history_ui_browsertest.cc is no longer auto-generated by

js2gtest, a simpler pattern can be used that does not require each test

case to use a different C++ class name.



Example renames:

- HistoryDrawerTest.All -> HistoryTest.Drawer

- HistoryItemTest.All -> HistoryTest.Item

- HistoryLinkClickTest.All -> HistoryTest.LinkClick



Where the meaningless "*.All" naming pattern is now unnecessary. This

also makes it a bit easier to run such tests as follows:

- browser_tests -> --gtest_filter=HistoryTest.*

- interactive_ui_tests -> --gtest_filter=HistoryFocusTest.*

entry.title: WebUI: Simplify the names and classes of c/b/r/side_panel tests.
entry.content:
Now that side_panel_browsertest.cc is no longer auto-generated by

js2gtest, a simpler pattern can be used that does not require each test

case to use a different C++ class name.



Specifically:

- Add a dedicated *_browsertest.cc file for each side_panel/ subfolder.

- Reduce the number of C++ test class names, and remove the

meaningless '*.All' naming pattern.



With this change running specific tests is much easier, for example

see queries below:

- Bookmarks -> --gtest_filter=SidePanelBookmarksTest.*

- Power Bookmarks -> --gtest_filter=SidePanelPowerBookmarksTest.*

- Commerce -> --gtest_filter=SidePanelShoppingInsightsTest.*

- UserNotes -> --gtest_filter=SidePanelUserNotesTest.*

- ReadAnything -> --gtest_filter=SidePanelReadingListTest.*

- All SidePanels -> --gtest_filter=SidePanel*Test.*



Bug: 1457360,1396268
